review_blob: I avoided this for a long time because I didnt think it sounded very appealing, even if it sounded interesting. So i finally picked up a bottle and was very impressed. Cloudy straw color, mild peach aroma. Flavor is slightly tart with a nicely present, but not overpowering peach flavor. It was perfect after a nice long walk with the dog on a warm fall day.

strong, sweet, sour aroma. almost like vinegar mixed with fruit juice. taste is surprisingly sweet. strong tase of tart apples up front, then more of a sweet apple flavor in the back with some honey and raspberry in the finish. with less sweetness and a bit more of the traditional lambic funk, this would be excellent. the sweetness is a bit too much for me, though its still drinkable.
22 oz. great hop aroma right from the start. crisp, fresh hop flavor, very citrusy/orange and somewhat sweet. slightly sticky mouthfeel, but smooth overall. One i could drink frequently.

Bought a six pack of this months ago, been hanging onto two of them just to see how they would age over time. poured into a sam adams lager glass. aroma is malty and somewhat boozy, can really smell quite a bit of alcohol. Its not that pleasant. taste is a sort of bitter molasses, caramel, slight coffee, touch of chocolate, then with a strong alcohol presence in the finish.
Its definitely one I just want to sip on slowly and not kick back too quick.
I bet this would be a great beer to marinate some steaks in, then drink one alongside them. I think thats what Ill save my last one for.

A very tasty brew. Nice aroma of spices with a hint of banana as well as a slightly cheese-like aroma, slightly barnyard. As it warms  and swirled it picks up a bit of alcohol aroma. Amazing level of carbonation of this brew. The carbonation on this is ridiculous. Even a gentle pour gives a billowing, rocky head that sticks forever on the glass.  The flavor is more fruity and banana like with a hint of spiciness, to me almost the reverse of the aroma.
definitely definitely definitely better when its had time to warm up. 
Looking forward to having this one again
on tap at the horsehoe pub. I wasnt blown away by this beer. It was good and a nice solid beer, but nothing really stood out. Would I have it again? Sure. Would I seek it out? No.
on tap at the horsehoe pub. ice hoppy pale ale. lots of hop flavor with a mild bitterness.  Would definitely like this as a session beer. looking forward to getting a six pack of this sometime.
on tap at the horsehoe pub. Very nice hoppy ipa. nice herbal hop flavor.  very enjoyable

From a growler. big fan of this beer. Nice sweet malt flavor, lots of caramel and a good hop bitterness. Aroma was malty but a bit too much alcohol in the nose. Would be a perfect session beer if it was a slight bit lower in alcohol. That was the only "downside" of this beer.

#100, definitely beat my goal of breaking 100 by the end of summer.
Sampled at ABF Night of the Lagers. info the night of, from the brewery, said this was just 12%, aged in bourbon barrel for about 11 months, then blended with a younger bock not aged in oak.
This was an excellent beer, my favorite of the ABF NotL. Huge malt flavor and a nice bourbon sweetness and warmth. Id love to just have a supply of this to last me all winter long.
beer_name: The Livery Bourbon Barrel Aged Wheat Trippelbock

review_blob: Sampled at ABF Night of the Lagers. Nice crisp clean pilsner. be a great one to have in the summer.

Sampled at ABF Night of the Lagers. Nice coffee aroma. The coffee flavor is balanced well with the malty bock flavor. Overall a great, interesting bock surprisingly well pulled off. A beer Id have for breakfast.
beer_name: Ithaca Excelsior! Kaffinator Double Espresso Bock

review_blob: Sampled at ABF Night of the Lagers. malty, strong alcohol warmth but not overdone. not the greatest bock
Sampled at ABF Night of the Lagers. Hoppy, grassy aroma, crisp flavor, great bitter finish with a nice malt backbone. Up there with the best IPAs in my book
Sampled from bottle at ABF Night of the Lagers. light for a bock. not much aroma. smooth, tasty and crisp.
Sampled on tap at ABF Night of the Lagers. Very grassy aromas with lots of hop flavor. surprisingly little bitterness. very very thick malt flavor.
too light and not enough alcohol to be a true bock. not as malty as it should be. drinkable and not bad but definitely not a bock.
Sampled at ABF Night of the Lagers. This was an excellent beer. Great crisp flavor. Some cheese-like flavor and aroma with a touch of smoke. One of my favorites of the night.
Sampled at ABF Night of the Lagers. probably would have been a great beer if i hadnt tasted it right after the tripel weizenbock.  overall it was good, nice malt and plenty of hops.
Sampled at ABF Night of the Lagers. Nice sweet, crisp malt flavor. Great hop flavor and aroma. One of my favorites from this brewery.
beer_name: Heavy Seas Small Craft Warning ber Pils

review_blob: pours light copper. not much head. the flavor is crisp, but overall thin. theres a mild bitter finish, with something else going on in the finish that i cant quite name. overall not the greatest beer, but i wouldnt turn it down if someone offered it to me.

poured copper. huge grassy hop aroma. huge hop flavor as well. pretty mild bitterness. citrusy, orangey, piney flavors and aromas come through more when it warms. enjoyable malt flavor. havent had a beer before with this much hop flavor with such low bitterness. kinda like sucking on a hop leaf.
Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. Mild hop aroma and flavor. Nice red color. Good malt flavor. Nice session beer, but not one Id seek out.
Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. This was a pretty standard porter. Nothing too great, nothing too bad. nice dark chocolate flavor, some roast coffee as well. Like I said, pretty standard.
Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. I liked this one quite a bit. Reminded me of a Saison I had from Millys in NH. Had a similar smoked gouda, peppery flavor. Was very impressed with this one.

beer_name: Dieu du Ciel Corne du Diable

review_blob: What a crap beer. I was probably biased to begin with when I saw that it advertised itself as having "no aftertaste." Tastes like a typical macro lager, albeit with a bit more flavor and body than the standard american kinds.
Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. Malt aroma up front, followed by cherry. I normally hate things that are cherry flavored but I really enjoyed this. It was nice and complex.
Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. Smelled and tasted of cheap, dirty honey. Was not impressed with this beer.
Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. Light, yeasty flavor. not much going on here, good or bad. Wasnt too impressed.
Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. deep red color. Nice hoppy aroma with good bitterness. Very nice beer/
beer_name: Rogue Dry Hopped St. Rogue Red Ale

review_blob: Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. Nice fruit ale, good for summer, but there are others out there that are just as good at half the price. I didnt pick up on any fake fruit extract flavor, which for me is the downfall of many fruit beers.
Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. Interesting bitter finish. hoppy aroma. It was a very odd beer to taste. A lot going on there. Not a bad beer, just somewhat confusing.

Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. Last beer of the fest. Had that familiar belgian yeast flavor. Its not bad, but I was getting a bit bored with it after tasting their other offerings. A good solid beer though, nice carbonation, light bitterness. Id have it again.

on tap at some bar in montreal. Less flavor than most wits. Im not a huge fan of the style to begin with, and this one didnt change my mind at all. Some citrus/orange flavors, but not much else going on there.
Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. Pours a nice gold color. surprisingly large carbonation bubbles. Slight peppery flavor, yeasty flavor and aroma. Nice beer.
Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. Great hoppy, bready aroma. Nice malt flavor followed by a great hop finish. Definitely want to sit down again with this one.
Pretty horrible beer. No real taste to it at all. Wish I hadnt wasted 8 damn dollars on this.
Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. Nitro. no real flavor. disappointed with this one. the rest of my notes say "lame."
Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. Great apricot aroma. taste doesnt follow through quite as much, but overall its a very nice fruit beer. great summer beer.
Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. Smooth nutty finish, very malty, bready nose. nice bitterness. Smooth beer. One of my favorites of the festival.
beer_name: Dieu du Ciel Imperial Cream Ale

review_blob: Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. Nice smoky malt aroma and flavor. Deep copper color. Nice beer.
Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. Bready aroma, not too hoppy. Good English style. Very drinkable.
This beer was absolutely too sweet. I couldnt even finish it. Other than that it had nothing really distinguishable about it. Just like drinking sugary water blended with brown ale
Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. Similar yeasty characteristics of other Unibroue beers. Overall nice, hides the alcohol amazingly well.
reminds me of cherry cough syrup poured in beer. have had this both on tap and from a bottle and it sucked both times.
Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. Light, estery. All my notes say other than that is "not too good."
Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. light, slightly sweet. smelled of sweet apple juice. Had it with breakfast and it went well. Got a bit too sweet after a while though
Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. Nice heavy beer, but not overpowering. Tasted dark chocolate and cherries. Great one to sip on a cooler night.
Sampled at Mondial de la Biere. Nice blueberry ale. Not overly strong on the blueberries. Good summer beer, but not one Id have all the time.
